creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
markings: red stamp LLC underneath first image: NE; in pencil LLC underneath seventh image: 60/104
medium: Illustrated book with seven woodcuts on Toshi paper, plus artist’s cover in heavy beige paper with woodcut title page, accordion-fold folio
provenance: [Dolf D. van Omme, Amsterdam, Netherlands, c. 2013-14, sold to Carl]; [William P. Carl Fine Prints, Durham, N.C., 2013/4-2016]; sold to MIA, 2016.
signed: in pencil under LRC of seventh image: Eekman
text: Death has been a subject of fascination for artists since the Middle Ages—its universality and omnipresence, its frightful nature, and its inevitable, and often unforeseen arrival for all. Here Nicolas Eekman treats the subject in seven haunting images, cramming his woodcuts with chilling imagery. Each depicts a terrifying bird or winged creature who has chosen a new victim to torment—men and women, oblivious and mindful, young and old—no one is spared.
title: Dance of Death in Seven Tempos (Dood dans in zeven tempo)
